title: Merry Christmas Everyone
author: joshagilend
aiHeadline: Merry Christmas to all the coders out there, may your day be filled with debugged code, efficient algorithms, and no pesky merge conflicts, but let's be real, you're probably stuck working on a holiday project anyway, so here's to a quiet night in with your laptop and a glass of eggnog!

title: This open problem taught me what topology is [video]
author: surprisetalk
aiHeadline: Because who needs actual human interaction on Christmas, this video on topology is the perfect excuse to stay indoors and learn about the intriguing world of shapes and spaces, all while eating leftover turkey and pretending you're a responsible adult, and hey, you might just learn something new, like what topology actually is, wow, mind blown!

title: Ruby 3.4.0
author: aaronbrethorst
aiHeadline: Ruby 3.4.0 is finally here, because what's Christmas without a little gift from the Ruby community, and by gift, I mean a bunch of new features and bug fixes that you'll probably spend the next few days trying to understand and implement, but hey, at least you'll have something to do while avoiding your relatives, so go ahead and upgrade, your code will thank you, or not, depending on how well you've written it!

title: Show HN: FixBrowser â€“ a lightweight web browser created from scratch
author: jezek2
aiHeadline: Introducing FixBrowser, the lightweight web browser that's so minimalist, it makes your grandma's browser look like a bloated mess, created from scratch by someone who clearly has too much time on their hands, but hey, who needs all those extra features anyway, it's not like you're going to use them, so go ahead and give FixBrowser a try, your RAM will thank you, or not, depending on how many tabs you have open!

title: Show HN: I made a website to semantically search ArXiv papers
author: Quizzical4230
aiHeadline: Tired of searching ArXiv papers like a normal human being, with keywords and stuff, well, say goodbye to those tedious days with PaperMatch, the website that lets you semantically search ArXiv papers, because who needs a social life when you can spend your Christmas searching for obscure research papers, and hey, you might just stumble upon something groundbreaking, or not, but at least you'll have learned something new, like how to waste an entire day browsing academic papers!
